intro: Silene uralensis subsp. arctica, commonly known as Arctic campion, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It is a herbaceous perennial with slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with a dense layer of fine hairs to reduce water loss. Silene uralensis subsp. arctica plays a role in stabilizing soil in its extreme habitat and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
